answers.answer: If he has normal heart function and there is no history of diabetes either approach is good.  Angioplasty with drug eluting stents has an excellent long term success rate with a very small chance of recurrence.  Life expectancy isn't related to that, instead it depends on the heart function, which I am assuming is normal in your dad.  He therefore would have a normal life expectancy.
